# Sai Surbehera

Sai Surbehera is a Machine Learning Engineer on Walmart's Algorithmic Search Experience Team, focusing on synthetic data generation for navigation. Holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science from Columbia University and a Bachelor’s degree in Information from the University of Michigan. Professional experience includes:

- Synthetic data generation for navigation and search experience optimization at Walmart Search; developed and deployed models to enhance search relevance and user navigation.
- Price prediction algorithms, cold start models, and click-through rate (CTR) prediction systems at Walmart Search; implemented machine learning pipelines for dynamic pricing and user engagement forecasting.
- Geo-coding algorithms at Philadelphia Inquirer and Columbia Journalism; designed and maintained systems for mapping and location extraction from textual data.
- Information extraction pipelines at American Family Insurance; built automated workflows for structured data extraction from unstructured insurance documents.
- Relation extraction pipelines at Mindgram; engineered models to identify and classify relationships between entities in large-scale datasets.
- Knowledge graph search and entity linking systems at University of Michigan Giving; developed tools for semantic search and entity disambiguation within philanthropic data.
- Theme-matching algorithms and text summarization at University of Stellenbosch; created models for thematic analysis and automated summarization of academic content.
- Fraud detection using GraphSage at AAA Insurance; applied graph neural networks to detect anomalous patterns and fraudulent activities in insurance claims.

Personal interests include independent project development, reading and writing about philosophy, and music appreciation. Contact available via email at ss6365@columbia.com and GitHub at https://github.com/saisurbehera. Based in New York City.
